page.title: 09Alston Sutton Farm
page.content: Alston Sutton farm also has many pigs. There are 250 sows, 13 boars and 2250 piglets. Every sow has two litters each year with about 13 piglets in each litter. Apart from looking after the animals the farmer has lots of other work to do. In spring he cuts the grass for hay and silage. When making silage the grass is cut and left to dry for 24 hours. A tractor and trailer takes the grass to the farmyard and it is tipped into a pile. It is then covered by polythene and old tyres to keep it dry. The cattle eat it in Winter when the grass does not grow in the fields.The farmer also grows maize, sweetcorn and barley on his farm. A farmers life is a very busy one indeed!
